originalText.text: We love Johnathan and Stephanie and all their events

text.text: We love Johnathan and Stephanie and all their events

originalText.text: I have loved living here. I would recommend this complex to anyone moving in the area.

text.text: I have loved living here. I would recommend this complex to anyone moving in the area.

originalText.text:
Save yourself a headache and find a different place to call home.

The Pros:
-Walking distance to Randall’s island/Central Park
-New in-complex fitness studio and lounge

The Cons:
-Constant package theft. There’s an Amazon hub in every building but there are not enough lockers to support the number of residents living in the building.
-Garbage rooms are rodent infested
-Neighbors can be rowdy and the vast majority are presumably living off welfare and spend their days smoking (even in common areas). The complex has gone through a recent facelift and there is tension between new tenants and those who have been living there for years.
-Security is a joke. We had a Ring camera and captured instances of groups of people running down our hallway with a firearm, someone trying to break into our unit, and homeless people living in the hallways. This was brought up to security and they did nothing. There are cameras located throughout the buildings but no one knows if they even work.
-The laundry rooms are constantly going through repairs. How do they expect thousands of residents to do their laundry with only 13 washers for the entire complex?
-Constant turnover of building managers and those who are there are unhelpful. We moved out before our lease was up and we communicated that with plenty of time. I spent 3 months asking for an invoice to pay for the incurred penalty and management was unresponsive. Fast forward to a few weeks ago, they sent the penalty fee to a collections agency which has been harassing my partner and I. They could have just handled this the proper way instead of bringing a third party. Bottom line: management is a mess

originalText.text:
The bad—-
1. Very limited and poor maintenance laundry room.
Currently 13 working washer and dryer that are shared by more than 1000 apartments units

2. Not professional new staff  and low efficiency management
Example—
1)   1966 building laundry room has been closed for more than 1 year and 1964 building laundry room has been down for 1 month.   The management team have no time line of when the  laundry rooms will be fixed to be reopen.

2) the new staff member in management office is very rude and intimidating.   She want us to stay at lease more than 4 feet away  from her  when we explain the issues. Don’t know if she afraid of getting sick from us or she has trouble having regular conversation with people.

3) water leaking issue in raining days in 1966 building 1st floor common area have been around for years and still not been addressed yet.

4) have mouse, cockroaches and pigeons issues in the entire complex

The good — new landscape, gym, community room and renovated
Apartment
